result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard R. Wilke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges.  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including mandatory DNA surcharge pursuant to Sec.973.046(1r), Wis. Stats.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

No contact with the victim wthiout the victim's and Agent's consent.
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------

The defendant is to pay any restitution if claimed. The Victim is to file her restitution request no later than March 4, 2015. The Defendant will have until April 6th to file any Motion for Restitution Hearing.
----------------------------
**AMENDMENT 03-07-2015 - IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant is to pay restitution in the amount of $1,562.00. The Defendant's bond money in the amount of $1,000.00 has been applied toward restitution and has been disbursed to the victim through the Clerk of Court's Office.  
----------------------------
2nd AMENDMENT 05-12-2015 - PURSUANT TO Order adopting Findings and Fact, filed on 05-12-2015, from restitution hearing held on April 14, 2015, IT IS ORDERED THAT the Defendant shall pay restitution to P.H.W. in the amount of $1,142.00. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED THAT the Defendant has the ability to pay restitution at the rate of $100.00 per month unless otherwise directed by probation agent or ordered by the Court. **NOTE: The Defendant has previously paid $1,000.00 toward restitution and that amount was disbursed to the victim on March 20, 2015. Therefore, the balance of restitution owed is $142.00. BALANCE OF RESTITUTION TO BE COLLECTED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
----------------------------

There is no agreement.

10:17 am Cross exam by Attorney Duquette. 
10:18 am Exhibit 2, Domestic Abuse Victim Worksheet, marked by clerk.

10:30 am Court questions witness.

Attorney Duquette asks court to receive Exhibit 4. 
No objection. 
Court receives Exhibit 4.

10:57 am Attorney Duquette closing argument.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Richard R. Wilke in court, in custody.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion for appointment of counsel is granted. Clerk to appoint. MInutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
SPD Notice of Ineligibility
Defendant appears in court, in custody. ADA Powell appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed. Petition for appointment of counsel sent to defendant.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Must post $1,000 cash. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH P.W. OR HER RESIDENCE.   If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. Reference SO# 14-2741.
See signature bond set 7/2/14
Defendant appears in court, in custody, with Edward Bailey and attorney Travis Schwantes. ADA Powell appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
